title: Software Engineering Specialist
description: Lead technical contact managing integration, security, and deployment of ISV developed web service on Predix (Cloud Foundry) IIoT platform. Assuming role mid-project, resolved all blockers and picked up outstanding tasks from ISV
Developed and automated deployment process for services on DCOS platform

title: Software Engineering Intern
description: Contributed to development of Target.com and Target app backend services, diagnosing and resolving issues in Groovy Spring code base and Ansible playbooks
Investigated and developed modern Mongo DB replication solution for Target.com, addressing compatibility, performance, scalability, and deployment considerations

title: Software Engineering Intern
description: QAA and UI development on Project Manager, an enterprise energy management tool, working on a Scrum team adhering to TDD methodology
Developed automated UI test suites utilizing Selenium WebDriver against an Angular/Node JS presentation tier, interfacing with RESTful business logic service.

Collaborated with other team members and remote teams to ensure project acceptance criteria were met and to solve issues including UI internationalization, data integrity, system integration, and data security and user authorization

title: Web Developer
description: Built and maintained LAMP web applications and systems with increasing responsibility, autonomy, and scope
Maintenance and redesign of catalog, database, and bibliography tools, various internal administrative and instructional interfaces, and data aggregation

title: Warp
description: In Warp, the player navigates a ship through the &lqout;warp fields&rquot; generated by music, with the goal of gathering as much energy as possible through the gems in the field. There are currently 2 type of gems:  energy and disruptor.Energy gems (green) accumulate in streaks while disruptor gems (black) temporarily inhibit your shipâ€™s ability to gather energy.

Based on work with Web Audio API in the Flare audio-visualizer, I developed an algorithm to produce game levels from audio files. These levels are rendered with a custom 3D rendering engine implemented in 2D canvas.

title: Mallet
description: Mallet (a lighter take on my «Hammer» C# game engine) is a 3D rendering engine built with Angular JS. Beyond performance enhancements like face-culling and abstracted web workers with pooling, Mallet features particle effects and a vector math library.

title: Flare
description: An audio-visualizer designed to evoke energy, power, and motion. Developed with HTML 5 Canvas and Angular to be highly performant and include multiple graphical effects. Instead of using raw audio data to produce the visualiation, data is analyzedto achieve a carefully tuned, visually appealing result.

title: Soul Train
description: Soul Train is an RPG where you play as detective on the Soul Train, helping restless spirits resolve the mysteries that are keeping them from moving on.
I developed most of the game code in Unity/C# including a mystery system that can dynamically generate game entities, including the entire story line, from JSON files.
team: Madison Smith, Bennoni Thomas, Justin John, Mark Obeldobel

title: Pinball
description: Our pinball game was developed with a sharp focus on creating an accurate simulation of bounce physics, from the ground up. Built on OpenGL in C++, utilizing various collision detection and resolution algorithms

title: Kd-Trees
description: Implementation of a Kd-Tree in C++ storing points with a visualiation in 3D space to demostrate features of the data structure

title: Garage Band
genre: Card-base party game with digital editor
description: Garage Band is a party game based around musical knowledge and (very loosley) abilities. Players complete challenges and sabatoge their friends to discard their hand
To facillitate development of this card game, I created an online tool that allowed easy editing and printing of the card set, so we could rapidly iterate
team: Courtney Balousek, Josh Willesey, Jade, Kaitlyn

title: St. Patrick's Cathederal
description: We created a detailed 3D simulation of a cathederal in Maya, and then ported into a Unity scene. This was a challenging set of models that includes large set pieces, models of humans, and a variety of materials. The scene required many different modelingtechniques to achieve.
team: Courtney Balousek, Liam Middlebrook, Mitch Leadley

title: Niks
description: Primarily developed at the 2014 IGM Halloween Hackathon, Niks features a familiar attempting to assist his ailing master against a series of warriors attempting to defeat him. Gameplay centered around tactics and avoidance, rather than direct combat.
Built on a custom Monogame C# 2D platformer engine, Hammer, artwork created by Courtney Balousek
team: Courtney Balousek, Michael Mullin, Vinicius Harres, Thomas Landi, Sean Maraia

title: Hammer
description: During the fall of 2014, our team wanted to build another game. To support this effort, I took the core physics and framework classes from Raptor Run and spun them off into a separate project, dubbed Hammer. It supported custom collisions for 2D boundingboxes that could be created for each frame in a sprite sheet in a GUI external editor, Anvil. Hammer included features like externally configured assets, debugging info, and a frame-by-frame execution of gameplay.

title: Raptor Run
description: It's the end of the age of the dinosaurs! You must out run the impending cataclysm for as long possible, while avoiding the other fleeing dinosaurs and navigating obstacle-filled terrain!
Built on a custom Monogame C# 2D platformer engine, Hammer, artwork created by Courtney Balousek
team: Courtney Balousek, Michael Mullin, Vinicius Harres

title: Trick or Treat Kitty
description: While trick-or-treating, Jimmy has been trapped inside a mysterious, convoluted mansion which holds many deep secrets. Help Jimmy solve the puzzles of the house and avoid the dangers within to escape!
Built with Construct 2, artwork created by Courtney Balousek
team: Courtney Balousek, Sean Maraia, Thomas Landi

title: Invasion
description: Earth is under attack! Defend the planet from the onslaught of the hellish invaders! Use your turret to fend off waves of enemies in fast-paced combat.
Built with Construct 2

title: St. John the Baptist
description: St. John the Baptist is a small Byzantine Catholic Parish in Lorain, Ohio that needed a simple website to reach out to the parishonners and the local community.

title: Mr. Dee's Karate Academy
description: Mr. Dee’s Karate supplied me with a great first project. The site has a simple and clean design, with rich content that is presented in a consistent and engaging manner. This site helped Mr. Dee's Karate to expand to new areas and receives a healthy stream of visitors from around the area. It also allows current students to know when to come to class and what is being taught each day.

title: DHA Auction Company, LLC
description: DHA Auction Company wanted to expand their business into the realm of online auctions and increase their online presence. I designed a new and a theme that integrated with their online auction platorm and provided technical assistance.

title: St. Thomas the Apostle
description: Saint Thomas the Apostle, a Catholic parish in my area, had an outdated site that needed to be updated to meet the parish's current needs. We set up a new site with a bright and inviting theme, but classic color scheme. The parish staff can now upload bulletins that parishoners can view and download as well as post other updates.

title: Elyria Catholic HS Floor Diagram
description: As a student at Elyria Catholic, I was commissioned to create an updated floor diagram of the school that met state requirements for emergency planning, as well as for use in new student orientation.

title: Whittguard Security & Patrol Services
description: Whittguard Security needed a new website to replace their outdated existing site, which included a system for handling employment applications that was updated.

title: Abbe Road Dental Arts
description: Dr. McNeely & Dr. Shuba wanted to be able to have a small online and provide basic information to their patients in the surrounding area, using a clean, professional theme.

title: National Material Recycling
description: National Material Recycling is a locally owned metal recycling business that was relying on an incomplete site. After originally designing a site in 2010, I recently updated it to incorporate the principles of responsive design, while still supporting old browsers. This allows the site to perform well on both the mobile devices and legacy computers that make up a large percentage of the site's visitors.

title: Java Wally's
description: Java’s operates Java Wally’s within the RIT Library. While working as a student web developer for the Wallace Center, I developed a new site for Java Wally’s that included a live webcam, hours, menu, contact form, and new photos of the cafe.
